question.text: Which of the following set represent the effect of noise pollution on human health?

options.text: Sleeplessness, increased heart beat, and altered breathing pattern
Sleeplessness, decreased heart beat, and altered breathing pattern
Sleeplessness, irritation of respiratory system, and altered breathing pattern
Sleeplessness, irritation of respiratory system, and inflammed lungs

solution.text: A brief exposure to extremely high sound level (150 dB or more), generated by take-off of a jet plane or rocket, may damage eardrums thus permanently impairing hearing ability. Even chronic exposure to a relatively lower noise level of cities may permanently damage the hearing abilities of humans. Noise also causes sleeplessness, increased heart beat, altered breathing patterns, thus considerably stressing humans.
